description:
It is sequencer, it has piano roll, many effects, plugins, synths including the all mighty zynaddsubfx, has drum sequencer, a lot of drum samples. It doesn't have what I don't use. Audio recording. But you can load in audio files. You can also load in midi files. 
What else do you need?

Excellent software. Remarkable sequencer, and great out-of-the-box support for ZynAddSubFX. My workflow with it is better than proprietary DAW because of its simplicity. Make sure you learn the sequencer keybindings, it will save you time.
Tried several others but prefer this by far.
It works. it gives you a good bit of control over what you do. the interface is a little awkward, but it gets easier to use once you mess with everything a bit.

Best of the best, especially on the Ubuntu distro family. If you are looking for a full-featured, powerful DAW, this is the one! Stable, well-documented & has a great community who are always happy to help.

I have a 3000x2000 screen and the application isn't displayed properly (to the extant that it's impossible to use it and not to break your eyes). 
 Seems to be a great app, but cannot use it. I've tried to change settings in settings/displays/scale, setting 100%, 125%, 150%, 175%, 200%, 300%. This scaling can change ubuntu icons and so on, but not this app. 
 Please, could you do something about it? I really want to use this app.
summary: Huge scaling problem on non-standard screens

description:
I never thought to even search for something like this. I didn't believe something like this existed but it does!

Very intuitive and easy to learn if you are already familiar with apps like Cubase or FL Studio.

There is as always things to wish for regarding UX and usability. This app really needs a way to rebind keys and mouse buttons (Middle click to delete is a pain in the **s on a laptop)

But all in all a surprisingly good music productivity suite! Lots of default instrument plugins and samples. Enough to get you started, and I believe it is even possible to use VSTi instruments.
summary: Comparable to professional software like Cubase

description: As much as I like using LMMS to make music on Linux when my PC isn't around, I don't like the fact that this version is more than 3 years old today. The Flatpak version on Flathub is much better and more up-to-date. Use that one instead.
summary: Out-of-Date. Use the Flatpak version instead

description: This is the app that amaze me the most on Ubuntu. it is so functional that i could hardly find a word to describe its efficiency
summary: Greatest app to have on ubuntu

description: The best free music composition software you can ask for, and trumps older equivalents like Anvil Studio.
Thanks a lot developpers
summary: WOW at Least i got this

description: FOR FREE ? ITS AMAZING HAD A GOOD TIME WITH IT

I've tried a lot of music sequencers which had many desirable features, but there was always this fiddly sound setup which didn't always work - or it worked one day then didn't the next - or I'd be able to play midi but not audio. LMMS just works. There's some things I miss, like notation, midi export, copying a block of segments over several tracks (I think some of these are in the works tho) - but it's easy to use, plays the stuff without any setup hassle, and has lots of sound-making gismos built-in. The beat/bassline editor is pretty useful. And I think it looks cool. If I want notation or a midi file, I use MuseScore. Between those two I can do all I want musically. - Terry
nothing happens when i click launch on ubuntu 19.10 :(
I can add plugins , nice UI , great SW
summary: Very Good composer SW , and light

description: Will not let me remove this app on linux ubuntu
LMMS is a very efficient and it basically has every feature for music producing. but where is the newest 1.2 version!

Okay first of all this installs version 1.1.3 an outdated version. Current version is 1.2.1, I wasn't able to figure it out how to install, instructions were too vague. The interface is tiny on a 4k monitor and there is no way to customize it. There is no way to record guitar/mic vocals/any live instruments, which also makes it impossible to use with any outboard gear or to re-amp anything. It seems to have some neat options but they are worthless without a decent interface and the ability to record any live instruments.
best app for linux
Great , 5stars.

Absolutely beautiful app. 

I wrote my first album in December within a month of following youtube tutorials. 

I have donated towards LMMS and will continue to do so. 

Very easy to learn after you follow a couple of youtube videos 

To save some time: you can move a note up by an octave with CTRL + UP and you can move it up by one note with SHIFT + UP
summary: An incredible piece of software with much to learn!

description: It's as good as any other programs I've used such as Fruityloops. Considering it's free, it's extremely surprising how well it performs, produces, and mixes! 5/5

I am using this on my Ubuntu dualboot machine
Best daw for linux
Being a FL and Cubase user on Windows 10, LMMS is the best music production app on linux
Very good job with this app
hey, thats pretty good...
As the title says, this app is super outdated. Should be 1.2, is 1.1 currently.

I am really happy I installed LMMS it works faultless with my Windows based VSTs with next to no latency. I have FL Studio running in Wine and latency is very high with overruns. LMMS no issues at all. Well done guys recommend this software for all Music lovers
it's 80% installed i still waiting to finish but somehow i just want to try to write some review (never been before)
summary: just want to try a review

description: Another great open source alternative!
After over than 10 years using Ableton, FL, Cubase, Garage Band I got lost on this application... No time to waste by trying to guess how this app works

LMMS is great software but this package as of me writing this review installs version 1.1.2, which is many years old at this point. The current version as I'm writing this is 1.2.2 and is much more modern and stable than this version. If you want a modern LMMS experience then go to https://lmms.io and download the latest AppImage.

Actually a perfect software for beginning artists, not like flstudio where you take an eternity to learn the GUI in lmms you can start easily with some soundfonts. You get to know midi editors, you can learn how to use FXs and plugins, which is very important in modern music production.
summary: Cool, perfect for my standards, would recommend to beginners

description: Awesome DAW, best one I've used - and it's free! I've had so much fun using this software.
A Simply Brilliant DAW :D
This is the best app out there! First time using in Ubuntu, just came over from windows, MUCH better experience!

Works great on Linux, use it on the daily to create simple to complex music. Is a little confusing at first, but spent two minutes to look up how to use it and picked it up easily. Very stable on older hardware, recommend for most systems.
Nice app for music creation
noice!!!!!
sqrew fl studio we have this
Adding in audio and third party plugin is a whole nightmare, and the interface is just outdated. Stock plugins are too simple and there is no way to zoom sideways on the arranger.
Been using since 2013. It's my go to. I love it.
summary: One of the best out there

description:
it doesnt have (an vst host to add vst) Vestige. 1.2.2 does (its available in lmms web)
i dont need fl wine . plus latency seems not good , excelent!
Very efficient for beginners (like me) and the VST handling is very nice. Could be a bit more efficient to use/have a guide, but the software itself is excellent.
summary: It's good! 1.3 is out now on their website

description: cool daw cause i cant afford to get fl studio/ableton B]
I thank this app because its the first DAW that I used

Amazing program to make music!!
Probobly the best one available on linux!
Best Linux DAW, recommend it for people with some experience
i think its better than some DAWs that aren't free
The best audio edit system out there and free how do they do it? Even if you don`t write music give a go for fun,

First, the installer froze my Ubuntu 20.04, then I had to dpkg repair the broken install manually and restart the computer; the second attempt took AGES again, stuck at 45% this time (before it crashed at 90%), then it was installed.
The GUI is ridiculously badly designed, unreadably tiny fonts, only a super-ugly dark interface, very badly to see eye-cancer checkboxes etc, and totally counter-intuitive. I seriously don't understand the good ratings.
Genrally high-end, but the newer versions are horrible for rapberry pi; glitchy with ubuntu on raspberry pi. Other that that, I love it!
summary: Genrally high-end, but the newer versions are horrible for rapberry pi

description:
This earlier version is fine
The later version is on the LMMS web site, however, has a useful EQ plugin included, a visual kind which looks very useful and easier to use.
The loop points are also better being much more prominent.
I've found various learning clips on youtube for this DAW which are a total godsend.
summary: Great DAW, worth learning how to use

description: very easy to use.
Let your creativity flow!

You can start making music instantly. Laying down a drum track while it's playing will show you how the program works. There are many add-ons and effects. I have seen amazing compositions made with LMMS. Just another reason to love Linux.
The app is hard at first but very powerful there are many tutorasl online
good, very good…
A very good app, kinda finnicky at first, but i got used to it in around half an hour. Extremely powerful - arguable better than Logic Pro!
This is the best music creation tool out there it does everything and more easy to use and great to learn if your new to music, and exellent for pro users too.
As far as I know version 1.2 has been in rc for over 2 years now. I have not contributed to the code and I don't know about its development complexities, but
I installed this on Windows 10 and love every minute making it--on that note, subscribe to EarthToAccess. Anyway, it's simply, easy to use, and fun to make music with.
summary: Definitely a must-have for the music makers

description: Wow, it's perfect for beginners I love it!

I have used this software to make multiple albums, sure there is a little bit of a learning curve - actually I am still learning :D - but once you know how to use this software it is the best way to make music on Linux. You can integrate Audacity in to your work flow if you want to record sound, and also grab acappelas from the Internet from Firefox. If you want to use VSTs just install wine. the community around LMMS is great too! I needed help writing a melody, i had someone call me on the discord helping me! Definitely worth the 5 stars imo
summary: Great software, even better on Fedora

description: I find it to be very cool. It is different to the kind of app I'm used to for music, but it sounds great
im gonna put a fart sample into this baby and make a slappin song,, ooh eyah      h100 / 5
So far, within Endless OS, this is the best music production app.

Als alter flp Jogger wollte ich eigentlich mal das alte Zeug benutzen, konnte aber leider kein einziges der Samples benutzen, die ich auch extra in den LMMS Sample Ordner gepackt hatte...Schade.
Dann eben neu anfangen mit gr0ßartigen Plugins...
Hey sehr cooles und benutzerfreundliches Programm, würde mich aber sehr über ein Update auf 1.2.2 freuen
summary: Tolles und kostenloses Programm für Music

description:
Für Anfänger etwas schwer, aber wenn man sich überwindet und sich rein arbeitet, dann lohnt es sich. Diese Software ist einfach nur genial. Möchte dazu sagen, ich verwende dieses Programm "zum Spaß", als Hobby so zu sagen, wie es jetzt bei einem User, der es professionell benutzt aussieht, kann ich nicht sagen, vermute jedoch er wird zumindest zufrieden sein. 
Also, installieren, lernen, Mukke machen... und ganz wichtig Spaß haben ;)
Es una de las mejores alternativas para fl studio, al menos para los que empiezan en esto de producir

LMMS provides an easy and effective environment for shaping and testing musical compositions, as well as enough tools and plugins/samples to create a fully fleshed and produced tune. It is, from the go, amazing for electronic sounds, but it also works wonderfully with Win32 instrument VSTs thanks to its built-in plugin VeSTige and the platform Wine, which gives it the ability to create beautiful orchestral sounds. I love to use it along with a scoring software like MuseScore or just a score notebook.
Publiquen la 1.2.0 para i386
Yo aprendi FL Studio en Windows y me encontre con esta maravilla en Linux, no solo se maneja practicamente igual sino que ademas es mas simple de configurar y sin problemas con licencias.

Muy buena interface, incluso si no estás familiarizado con éste tipo de software, aprendes rápido y es muy potente. Horas de diversión aseguradas, posibilidades infinitas. Enhorabuena y gracias a los desarrolladores, diseñadores, testers, etc.
Una aplicación imprescindible para el músico.
Increiblemente simple y productivo para comenzar
aún no la se usar del todo bien, pero me esta encantando al igual que linux Ubuntu (soy nuevo).

Ya llevo años utilizandolo y estoy encantado con el. Utilizaba ableton pero me canse de gastar cientos de euros en software y equipos potentes para hacerlo andar.
Este funciona de maravilla incluso en maquinas de pocos recursos, es muy configurable, la calidad de sonido es buena y jamas ha tenido un cuelgue o algun chasquido de nada . Si a esto le sumas lo estable que es y el juego que te da junto a Ubuntu studio es ideal para poder producir cosas sin que el dinero limite tu imaginacion. Pienso que encontrar algo mejor solo seria posible a manos de su creador, enhorabuena y muchas gracias.
summary: Para mi es el mejor que hay

Depuis mes débuts en composition j'utilise ce logiciel, et pour un logiciel gratuit, il est excellent !
Il est de la même qualité que d'autres logiciels payants. Seul ennuie : le son sature assez facilement. Il faut donc bien gérer le volume de chaque piste.

Super logiciel pour faire de la musique. Je recommande cette application à tout le monde.

Points forts:
